White Belt.01-01 ZOMBIE ISLAND: 1. Learn the basics of how to start and stop games.
White Belt.01-02 FUN WITH SHAPES:
1.Understand how to arrange objects on the stage.
2. Understand how to resize radius of circle.
White Belt.01-03 PROVE YOURSELF:
1. Show understanding of setting stage in the GDP.
2. This project combines all of the previous topics. Ask the student to be creative!
White Belt.02-02 MULTIPLE STARS:
1. Explain parameters.
2. Explain speed of rotation.
White Belt.02-03 SPIN ALL OBJECTS: 1. Explain the difference between this project and the last.
White Belt.02-04 SPIN COUNTER-CLOCKWISE: 1. Explain what a negative 2nd parameter does.
White Belt.02-05 SPIN PROVE YOURSELF: 1. This project combines all of the previous topics. Ask the student to be creative!
White Belt.03-01 SIDE WALL BOUNCE:
1. Explain if/then statements.
2. Explain boolean logic.
3. Explain moveX
White Belt.03-04 PROVE YOURSELF BUBBLES: 1. This project continues the concepts from the previous activity. Encourage the student to do the bonus steps!
White Belt.04-02 BASIC PONG WITH KEYBOARD:
1. Explain the basics of movement code.
2. Explain how cloning works.
3. Explain the Mouse Click event.
White Belt.05-01 COCONUT CHAOS:
and height functions work.
2. Explain how comments work.
White Belt.OPTIONAL - 07-01 STARTAG (JAVASCRIPT): 1. This project continues concepts from the previous project.
White Belt.OPTIONAL - 07-02 AVOID THE BUGS (JAVASCR:
1. Understand how to use “Search Assets.”
2. Encourage the student to follow step 33.

Yellow Belt.01-02 RAIN CATCHER PART 2:
1. Explains the isKeyPressed function
2. Explain the parameters of the isKeyPressed function
Yellow Belt.01-03 RAIN CATCHER PART 3: 1. Explains what the random function does
Yellow Belt.01-04 RAIN CATCHER PART 4: 1. Explains what the clone function does
Yellow Belt.01-05 RAIN CATCHER PART 5:
1. Explains what timers are
2. Understands that functions can be parameters for other functions
Yellow Belt.01-06 RAIN CATCHER PART 6: 1. Explains what hexcode color codes are
Yellow Belt.PROVE YOURSELF - RAIN CATCHER COMPLETE:
1. Combination of all other Rain Catchers
a test to see if they can put it all together from scratch
Yellow Belt.PROVE YOURSELF - COLOR CHANGE:
1. Basic version reiterates use of fill() from RC Part 6
2. More complicated version can use isTouching() while dragging
Yellow Belt.02-01 METEORS PART 1:
1. Reinforces the random function
2. Explains what the rotation function does
Yellow Belt.02-02 METEORS PART 2:
1. Ask the ninja to explain the code
and debug
2. Reinforce what the clone function does
Yellow Belt.PROVE YOURSELF - ROLLING DICE:
1. Uses random
Math.round()
and frameIndex()
2. Explains numbering in computing systems (starting at 0 instead of 1)
Yellow Belt.03-01 HIDING NINJA: 1. Explains what the toggleVisable function does
Yellow Belt.03-02 HIDING NINJAS: 1. Reinforces what the toggleVisable function does
Yellow Belt.03-03 WHACK A NINJA:
1. Ask the ninja to explain the code
and debug
Yellow Belt.03-04 NINJA SUPPLIES: 1. Explains what the toggleDraggable function does
Yellow Belt.PROVE YOURSELF - WHAT'S INSIDE?:
1. Goes over use of frameIndex() from Meteors Deluxe
2. Application of random to decide what’s hiding
3. visible() function used heavily
Yellow Belt.PROVE YOURSELF - ROCK PAPER SCISSORS:
1. Focuses on game logic
albeit simple.
2. Combines several different methods across projects
3. Explain how visible()
random()
frameIndex() and comparison operators are used in the gameplay loop
Yellow Belt.PROVE YOURSELF - ROBOT BUILDER: 1. Same as Ninja Puzzle. Sets x and y positions of objects and deals with draggable property
Yellow Belt.04-01 BUMPER CAR: 1. Explains what the flipDirection function does
Yellow Belt.04-02 BALLOON PROTECT: 1. Explains what the remove function does
Yellow Belt.04-03 NINJA SNACKS:
1. Explains the two usages of the moveTo() method (moveTo(object) and moveTo(x
y) )
Yellow Belt.04-04 SHURIKEN TOSS PART 1: 1. Explains what the moveToObject() function does
Yellow Belt.04-05 SPACE TOUR:
1. Reinforces the moveToObject() function
2. Explains what the pointToObject() function
Yellow Belt.04-06 SHURIKEN TOSS PART 2:
1. Explains what the moveForwardByRotation()
2. Explains the pointToCursor()
Yellow Belt.04-07 NINJA BATTLE:
1. Explains the pointToObject() function
2. Explains the rotation() method and understands the parameters
Yellow Belt.PROVE YOURSELF - CANDY SORT:
1. Spawning candy is similar to Rain Catcher
2. Explain logic for checking if candy is in the right bin
and what happens when it isn’t
Yellow Belt.05-01 STARSCAPE: 1. Reinforces what the remove function does
Yellow Belt.05-02 ZAPPER PART 1:
1. Ask the ninja to explain the code
and debug
Yellow Belt.05-03 ZAPPER PART 2: 1. Explains what the isTouching() method does
Yellow Belt.05-04 WALL BLASTER:
1. Ask the ninja to explain the code
and debug
Yellow Belt.PROVE YOURSELF - COLOR CHANGE PART 2:
1. Use of isTouching boolean function and dragging
2. Shows how the same problem can be solved in a different way than the first time
Yellow Belt.PROVE YOURSELF - LIFT OFF:
1. Similar to Ninja Supplies
can be done by either clicking or dragging
2. As a challenge for older students
they can specify the order that objects need to be dragged in order to win
Yellow Belt.PROVE YOURSELF - BUBBLES: Looks like the same bubbles that’s in White Belt, they can skip
Yellow Belt.06-01 METEORS DELUXE: 1. Create a new game from scratch using concepts learned throughout the belt
Yellow Belt.PROVE YOURSELF - BUG INVADERS:
1. Use of createTimer() and clone() to create enemies
similar to Rain Catcher
2. Explain how booleans are used to check for movement
